name: GetPendingAccessRequests
description:
Fetch pending access requests for a target object.

Use this tool to retrieve pending access requests for a specific target object in Asana. You can also filter these requests by a specific user if needed.

parameters.name: target_object_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the target object in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the target object.

parameters.name: filter_by_user
parameters.description: User identifier to filter requests. Accepts 'me', an email, or a user gid.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for readable, indented output. Use primarily for debugging due to increased response size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the target object.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the target object.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.
